intro: Scabiosa gussonei, commonly known as the Italian scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, cylindrical seed pods that release tiny seeds. Scabiosa gussonei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
